<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!-->


**What happened**:
When the conditionType specified in Readiness Gates changes from non-existent to False, the reason of ready condition keep `does not exist`.
```
status:
  conditions:
  - lastProbeTime: null
    lastTransitionTime: "2018-12-24T18:33:32Z"
    reason: set false manually
    status: "False"
    type: zte.com.cn/huang
  - lastProbeTime: null
    lastTransitionTime: "2018-12-24T18:32:06Z"
    message: corresponding condition of pod readiness gate "zte.com.cn/huang" does
      not exist.
    reason: ReadinessGatesNotReady
    status: "False"
    type: Ready
```

**What you expected to happen**:
when set the condition status to False , the message of ready condition can changed.
`message: the status of pod readiness gate "zte.com.cn/huang" is not "True", but False`

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Create a deployment with Readiness Gate without set the condition specified in Readiness
2. Set the condition Status specified in Readiness to False
